p.s: Since you have asked whether Germany would be able to become independent and cut itself off from globalization or not I have read an Articlearticle online.
The Articlearticle is named Verf√ºhrerische Isolation by Mark Schieritz.
It says that Germany earns a lot of money and jobs due to international traits.
Almost 1.3 billion euros and every second job is linked to exports.
If Germany still wanted to become independent, companies would have to change production and transport systems.
This is problematic since we have gaps in skills and jbs and we require people from other countries to fill those.
If we were to get independent fundamental conditions to live would still be provided.
There would be the possibility that we share out affluence, since there is no more economic competition or job competition.
Things that would change to the worse would be that life would get more boring.
You would not be able to buy exotic fruits unless you buy then for a really expensive price.
Some things you would not be able to buy at all, such as designer clothing or medication from other countries.
In addition to that Germany would not take part in change.
That the rest of the world is going through: Not economically neither socially.
Therefore international trade is important for Germany's prosperity.
It connects people, brings new inventions and change.
I hope I could help you out with your question.
